trans-unit.source: Describes the Microsoft content channels that employees, partners, and community contributors should use for publishing Azure technical content.
trans-unit.target: Describes the Microsoft content channels that employees, partners, and community contributors should use for publishing Azure technical content.

trans-unit.source: Generally speaking, core technical content for Microsoft Azure belongs in the Azure Documentation Center (<link><linkText>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation</linkText><title></title></link> or in the Azure scoped library (<link><linkText>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/</linkText><title></title></link> .
trans-unit.target: Generally speaking, core technical content for Microsoft Azure belongs in the Azure Documentation Center (<link><linkText>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation</linkText><title></title></link> or in the Azure scoped library (<link><linkText>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/</linkText><title></title></link> .

trans-unit.source: Click the image to open the PDF that contains details for our technical content channel guidance:
trans-unit.target: Click the image to open the PDF that contains details for our technical content channel guidance:

trans-unit.source: The following channels are not part of the standard Azure technical content experience:
trans-unit.target: The following channels are not part of the standard Azure technical content experience:

trans-unit.source: TechNet Library: TechNet does not offer an Azure branded experience.
trans-unit.target: TechNet Library: TechNet does not offer an Azure branded experience.

trans-unit.source: All content for all audiences goes in the branded, scoped Azure library hosted on MSDN.
trans-unit.target: All content for all audiences goes in the branded, scoped Azure library hosted on MSDN.

trans-unit.source: TechNet Wiki: The wiki does not offer an Azure branded experience.
trans-unit.target: TechNet Wiki: The wiki does not offer an Azure branded experience.

trans-unit.source: The community and internal partners can contribute to Azure technical content through the Discus comment stream and by contributing to articles through GitHub.
trans-unit.target: The community and internal partners can contribute to Azure technical content through the Discus comment stream and by contributing to articles through GitHub.

trans-unit.source: Standard MSDN library view: Standard view does not offer an Azure branded experience.
trans-unit.target: Standard MSDN library view: Standard view does not offer an Azure branded experience.

trans-unit.source: TechNet TechCenters: Our "centers" are published to azure.microsoft.com/documentation.
trans-unit.target: TechNet TechCenters: Our "centers" are published to azure.microsoft.com/documentation.

trans-unit.source: MSDN DevCenters: Our "centers" are published to azure.microsoft.com/documentation.
trans-unit.target: MSDN DevCenters: Our "centers" are published to azure.microsoft.com/documentation.

trans-unit.source: E-book, CSI e-book gallery: Due to static nature of content, do not deliver content in e-book form.
trans-unit.target: E-book, CSI e-book gallery: Due to static nature of content, do not deliver content in e-book form.

trans-unit.source: The vast majority of content should be published through azure.microsoft.com or to the Azure scoped library.
trans-unit.target: The vast majority of content should be published through azure.microsoft.com or to the Azure scoped library.
